title: Oil Pump Pressure Relief Valve - Inspection

body.body: Oil Pump Pressure Relief Valve - Inspection
The spring is under pressure and can cause injury if released suddenly.
Always put on suitable eye protection and release the spring slowly.
Failure to follow the advice above could result in minor to moderate injury.
Remove the washer to release the spring and piston from the oil pump housing.
Measure the length of the spring (see
). If the spring length is less than the specification, replace the spring.
Examine the piston for damage and wear. If there is damage or wear, replace the piston.
Check the piston in the oil pump housing for smooth operation. If the piston does not move easily, replace the piston or the housing.
Examine the piston bore in the housing. If there is damage or wear, replace the housing.
Assemble the piston and spring into the housing and install the washer.
